DataElement.preferredName: Transient Myeloproliferative Disorder First Remission Confirmation Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of the first remission of Transient Myeloproliferative Disorder, a myeloid proliferation occurring in newborns with Down syndrome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transient Myeloproliferative Disorder First Remission Confirmation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the confirmation of the first remission of  Transient Myeloproliferative Disorder, a myeloid proliferation occurring in newborns with Down syndrome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A myeloid proliferation occurring in newborns with Down syndrome.  It is clinically and morphologically indistinguishable from acute myeloid leukemia and is associated with GATA1 mutations.  The blasts display morphologic and immunophenotypic features of megakaryocytic lineage.  In the majority of patients the myeloid proliferation undergoes spontaneous remission.

Concepts.longName: Transient Abnormal Myelopoiesis Associated with Down Syndrome
Concepts.definition: A myeloid proliferation occurring in newborns with Down syndrome.  It is clinically and morphologically indistinguishable from acute myeloid leukemia and is associated with GATA1 mutations.  The blasts display morphologic and immunophenotypic features of megakaryocytic lineage.  In the majority of patients the myeloid proliferation undergoes spontaneous remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).:Having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
